## Other R plotting systems

Base R graphics (e.g., `plot()`)

- Ugly
- Very verbose

Lattice (`library(lattice)`)

- Largely overlappying functionality with ggplot
- Much less friendly interface (really)

glimpse(iris)

## Basics of ggplot

```{r echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
library("ggplot2")
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width)) + 
  geom_point() 
```

- Load the `ggplot` package
- `ggplot()` sets up the plot using `iris` data.frame.
- `aes()` sets `x` and `y` variables
- `geom_point()` adds `(x, y)` points corresponding to `Petal.Length` and `Petal.Width`

## Logic of ggplot

- Building plots up by layers
    - Start simple
- Layers can be:
    - data
    - labels
    - colors
    - regression lines, etc.
- Change the theme (shading, colors, line widths, etc.)
- You might see examples with `qplot()`. Ignore them. Learn ggplot the hard way. Shortcuts will limit you in the long run.

## Logic of ggplot

```{r eval=FALSE}
library("ggplot2")
library("cowplot")  # Easy on the eyes ggplot theme
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width)) +
  geom_point() 
```

## Building plots

```{r echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width, color = Species)) + 
  geom_point()
```

- `color = Species` colors points by the _Species_ column (a categorical variable)

## Building plots

```{r echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
library("wesanderson")
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width,
                 color = Species)) + 
  geom_point(size = 3) + 
  scale_color_manual(values = wes_palette("Moonrise2"))
```

- Add an interesting color palette

## Building plots

```{r echo=FALSE}
library("wesanderson")
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width, color = Species)) + 
  geom_point(size = 3) + 
  scale_color_manual(values = wes_palette("Moonrise2"))
```

## Building plots

```{r echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
library("wesanderson")
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width,
                 color = Species)) + 
  geom_point(size = 3) + 
  scale_color_manual(values = wes_palette("Moonrise2")) +
  xlab("Petal Length (cm)") +
  ylab("Petal Width (cm)") +
  ggtitle("Irises")
```

- Add some better axis labels

## Building plots

```{r echo=FALSE}
library("wesanderson")
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width, color = Species)) + 
  geom_point(size = 3) + 
  scale_color_manual(values = wes_palette("Moonrise2")) +
  xlab("Petal Length (cm)") +
  ylab("Petal Width (cm)") +
  ggtitle("Irises")
```

## Adding lines

```{r echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width)) + 
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm")
```

- `geom_line()` add a "smooth" line (but in this case linear [`lm`])

## Adding lines

```{r echo=FALSE}
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width)) + 
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm")
```

```{r eval=FALSE}

                 color = Species)) +

```

## Facetting

```{r eval=FALSE}
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length)) + 
  geom_histogram() +
  facet_grid(Species ~ .)
```

- Plots separate histograms for the 3 species in 3 rows
- `facet_grid(. ~ Species)` makes 3 columns

## Facetting

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length)) + 
  geom_histogram() +
  facet_grid(Species ~ .)
```
